<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" xml:lang="en" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace.html and http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml for information about this namespace.
This schema document describes the XML namespace, in a form suitable for import by other schema documents.
Note that local names in this namespace are intended to be defined only by the World Wide Web Consortium or its subgroups. The following names are currently defined in this namespace and should not be used with conflicting semantics by any Working Group, specification, or document instance:
base (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value provides a URI to be used as the base for interpreting any relative URIs in the scope of the element on which it appears; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML Base specification.
id (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value should be interpreted as if declared to be of type ID. The xml:id specification is not yet a W3C Recommendation, but this attribute is included here to facilitate experimentation with the mechanisms it proposes. Note that it is _not_ included in the specialAttrs attribute group.
lang (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value is a language code for the natural language of the content of any element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.
space (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value is a keyword indicating what whitespace processing discipline is intended for the content of the element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.
Father (in any context at all): denotes Jon Bosak, the chair of the original XML Working Group. This name is reserved by the following decision of the W3C XML Plenary and XML Coordination groups:
In appreciation for his vision, leadership and dedication the W3C XML Plenary on this 10th day of February, 2000 reserves for Jon Bosak in perpetuity the XML name xml:Father</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This schema defines attributes and an attribute group suitable for use by schemas wishing to allow xml:base, xml:lang or xml:space attributes on elements they define.
To enable this, such a schema must import this schema for the XML namespace, e.g. as follows: <schema . . .> . . . <import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2001/03/xml.xsd"/>
Subsequently, qualified reference to any of the attributes or the group defined below will have the desired effect, e.g.
<type . . .> . . . <attributeGroup ref="xml:specialAttrs"/>
will define a type which will schema-validate an instance element with any of those attributes</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In keeping with the XML Schema WG's standard versioning policy, this schema document will persist at http://www.w3.org/2005/08/xml.xsd. At the date of issue it can also be found at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd. The schema document at that URI may however change in the future, in order to remain compatible with the latest version of XML Schema itself, or with the XML namespace itself. In other words, if the XML Schema or XML namespaces change, the version of this document at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd will change accordingly; the version at http://www.w3.org/2005/08/xml.xsd will not change.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="lang"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Attempting to install the relevant ISO 2- and 3-letter codes as the enumerated possible values is probably never going to be a realistic possibility. See RFC 3066 at http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt and the IANA registry at http://www.iana.org/assignments/lang-tag-apps.htm for further information.
The union allows for the 'un-declaration' of xml:lang with the empty string.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:union memberTypes="xs:language"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value=""/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:union> </xs:simpleType> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="space"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:NCName"> <xs:enumeration value="default"/> <xs:enumeration value="preserve"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="base" type="xs:anyURI"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for information about this attribute.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="id" type="xs:ID"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-id/ for information about this attribute.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:attribute> <xs:attributeGroup name="specialAttrs"> <xs:attribute ref="xml:base"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:lang"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:space"/> </xs:attributeGroup> </xs:schema>

</xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AddressType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="AddressLine1" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="AddressLine2" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> response as part of Property Addresses--> <xs:element name="ISOStateProvinceCode" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <!--Bijay : ENH206479 :END--> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CodeNamePairType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Code" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Name" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="TypeType"> <xs:attribute name="Code" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="Name" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:lang" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="IdTypeType"> <xs:attribute name="Id" type="xs:int" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="Code" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="Name" <xs:schema targetNamespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" xml:lang="en" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace.html and http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml for information about this namespace.
This schema document describes the XML namespace, in a form suitable for import by other schema documents.
Note that local names in this namespace are intended to be defined only by the World Wide Web Consortium or its subgroups. The following names are currently defined in this namespace and should not be used with conflicting semantics by any Working Group, specification, or document instance:
base (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value provides a URI to be used as the base for interpreting any relative URIs in the scope of the element on which it appears; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML Base specification.
id (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value should be interpreted as if declared to be of type ID. The xml:id specification is not yet a W3C Recommendation, but this attribute is included here to facilitate experimentation with the mechanisms it proposes. Note that it is _not_ included in the specialAttrs attribute group.
lang (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value is a language code for the natural language of the content of any element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.
space (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value is a keyword indicating what whitespace processing discipline is intended for the content of the element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.
Father (in any context at all): denotes Jon Bosak, the chair of the original XML Working Group. This name is reserved by the following decision of the W3C XML Plenary and XML Coordination groups:
In appreciation for his vision, leadership and dedication the W3C XML Plenary on this 10th day of February, 2000 reserves for Jon Bosak in perpetuity the XML name xml:Father</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This schema defines attributes and an attribute group suitable for use by schemas wishing to allow xml:base, xml:lang or xml:space attributes on elements they define.
To enable this, such a schema must import this schema for the XML namespace, e.g. as follows: <schema . . .> . . . <import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2001/03/xml.xsd"/>
Subsequently, qualified reference to any of the attributes or the group defined below will have the desired effect, e.g.
<type . . .> . . . <attributeGroup ref="xml:specialAttrs"/>
will define a type which will schema-validate an instance element with any of those attributes</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In keeping with the XML Schema WG's standard versioning policy, this schema document will persist at http://www.w3.org/2005/08/xml.xsd. At the date of issue it can also be found at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd. The schema document at that URI may however change in the future, in order to remain compatible with the latest version of XML Schema itself, or with the XML namespace itself. In other words, if the XML Schema or XML namespaces change, the version of this document at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd will change accordingly; the version at http://www.w3.org/2005/08/xml.xsd will not change.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="lang"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Attempting to install the relevant ISO 2- and 3-letter codes as the enumerated possible values is probably never going to be a realistic possibility. See RFC 3066 at http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt and the IANA registry at http://www.iana.org/assignments/lang-tag-apps.htm for further information.
The union allows for the 'un-declaration' of xml:lang with the empty string.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:union memberTypes="xs:language"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value=""/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:union> </xs:simpleType> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="space"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:NCName"> <xs:enumeration value="default"/> <xs:enumeration value="preserve"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="base" type="xs:anyURI"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for information about this attribute.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="id" type="xs:ID"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-id/ for information about this attribute.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:attribute> <xs:attributeGroup name="specialAttrs"> <xs:attribute ref="xml:base"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:lang"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:space"/> </xs:attributeGroup> </xs:schema>

</xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--Bijay : EZ Yield Enhancement : END--> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" xml:lang="en" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace.html and http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml for information about this namespace.
This schema document describes the XML namespace, in a form suitable for import by other schema documents.
Note that local names in this namespace are intended to be defined only by the World Wide Web Consortium or its subgroups. The following names are currently defined in this namespace and should not be used with conflicting semantics by any Working Group, specification, or document instance:
base (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value provides a URI to be used as the base for interpreting any relative URIs in the scope of the element on which it appears; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML Base specification.
id (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value should be interpreted as if declared to be of type ID. The xml:id specification is not yet a W3C Recommendation, but this attribute is included here to facilitate experimentation with the mechanisms it proposes. Note that it is _not_ included in the specialAttrs attribute group.
lang (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value is a language code for the natural language of the content of any element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.
space (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value is a keyword indicating what whitespace processing discipline is intended for the content of the element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.
Father (in any context at all): denotes Jon Bosak, the chair of the original XML Working Group. This name is reserved by the following decision of the W3C XML Plenary and XML Coordination groups:
In appreciation for his vision, leadership and dedication the W3C XML Plenary on this 10th day of February, 2000 reserves for Jon Bosak in perpetuity the XML name xml:Father</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This schema defines attributes and an attribute group suitable for use by schemas wishing to allow xml:base, xml:lang or xml:space attributes on elements they define.
To enable this, such a schema must import this schema for the XML namespace, e.g. as follows: <schema . . .> . . . <import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2001/03/xml.xsd"/>
Subsequently, qualified reference to any of the attributes or the group defined below will have the desired effect, e.g.
<type . . .> . . . <attributeGroup ref="xml:specialAttrs"/>
will define a type which will schema-validate an instance element with any of those attributes</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In keeping with the XML Schema WG's standard versioning policy, this schema document will persist at http://www.w3.org/2005/08/xml.xsd. At the date of issue it can also be found at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd. The schema document at that URI may however change in the future, in order to remain compatible with the latest version of XML Schema itself, or with the XML namespace itself. In other words, if the XML Schema or XML namespaces change, the version of this document at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd will change accordingly; the version at http://www.w3.org/2005/08/xml.xsd will not change.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="lang"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Attempting to install the relevant ISO 2- and 3-letter codes as the enumerated possible values is probably never going to be a realistic possibility. See RFC 3066 at http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt and the IANA registry at http://www.iana.org/assignments/lang-tag-apps.htm for further information.
The union allows for the 'un-declaration' of xml:lang with the empty string.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:union memberTypes="xs:language"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value=""/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:union> </xs:simpleType> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="space"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:NCName"> <xs:enumeration value="default"/> <xs:enumeration value="preserve"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="base" type="xs:anyURI"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for information about this attribute.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="id" type="xs:ID"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-id/ for information about this attribute.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:attribute> <xs:attributeGroup name="specialAttrs"> <xs:attribute ref="xml:base"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:lang"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:space"/> </xs:attributeGroup> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" schemaLocation="xml.xsd"/> <!--MODELS--> <xs:simpleType name="simpleDirectionType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="N"/> <xs:enumeration value="S"/> <xs:enumeration value="E"/> <xs:enumeration value="W"/> <xs:enumeration value="NE"/> <xs:enumeration value="NW"/> <xs:enumeration value="SE"/> <xs:enumeration value="SW"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="DistanceType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Qty" type="xs:double"/> <xs:element name="Unit" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="GeocodeType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Lat" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element name="Lon" type="xs:decimal"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="StationsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="Station" type="StationType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="StationType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="GeoCode" type="GeocodeType"/> <xs:element name="Code" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Name" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Direction" type="simpleDirectionType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Distance" type="DistanceType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AddressType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="AddressLine1" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="AddressLine2" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="AddressLine3" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="AddressLine4" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="City" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <!--TODO switch back to choice, a sequence is used due to lack of support for choice in jax-rpc 1.1, waiting for JAX-WS (100% schema support)--> <xs:sequence minOccurs="0"> <xs:element name="State" type="CodeNamePairType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Province" type="CodeNamePairType" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:element name="PostalCode" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="County" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Country" type="CodeNamePairType" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CodeNamePairType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Code" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Name" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="TypeType"> <xs:attribute name="Code" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="Name" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:lang" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="IdTypeType"> <xs:attribute name="Id" type="xs:int" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="Code" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="Name" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="UOMType"> <xs:attribute name="UOMId" type="xs:long" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="UOMCode" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="UOMName" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="UOMQty" type="xs:double" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://mapquest.dto.sherlock.valhalla.starwood.com" xmlns="http://mapquest.dto.sherlock.valhalla.starwood.com" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:include schemaLocation="MapquestCommonTypes.xsd"/> <!--MAPQUEST ELEMENTS--> <xs:element name="GeoCode" type="GeocodeType"/> <xs:element name="PropMap" type="PropMapType"/> <xs:element name="Distance" type="DistanceType"/> <xs:element name="AreaMap" type="AreaMapType"/> <xs:element name="SearchMap" type="SearchMapType"/> <!--END OF MAPQUEST ELEMENTS--> <xs:complexType name="AlternateLocationResultsType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="AddressType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="GeoCode" type="GeocodeType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" ref="MapUri"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="Type" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PropMapType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>defines a map of a property</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element ref="MapUri"/> <xs:element ref="MapScale"/> <xs:element name="ZoomLevel" type="ZoomLevelType"/> <xs:element ref="SessionID"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AreaMapType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>defines a map used to show one or more properties in an area</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element ref="MapUri"/> <xs:element ref="MapScale"/> <xs:element name="ZoomLevel" type="ZoomLevelType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" ref="SessionID"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SearchMapType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Map" type="MapType"/> <xs:element name="XYPoint" type="XYPointType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:element name="LocationResults" type="LocationResultsType"/> <xs:complexType name="LocationResultsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="Location" type="AlternateLocationResultsType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:include schemaLocation="CommonTypes.xsd"/> <xs:element name="MapUri" type="xs:anyURI"/> <xs:element name="SessionID" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="MapScale" type="xs:integer"/> <xs:simpleType name="ZoomLevelType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="2"/> <xs:enumeration value="3"/> <xs:enumeration value="4"/> <xs:enumeration value="5"/> <xs:enumeration value="6"/> <xs:enumeration value="7"/> <xs:enumeration value="8"/> <xs:enumeration value="9"/> <xs:enumeration value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="XYPointType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="X" type="xs:double"/> <xs:element name="Y" type="xs:double"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="MapquestDimensionType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Width" type="xs:int"/> <xs:element name="Height" type="xs:int"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="MapType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element ref="MapUri"/> <xs:element ref="SessionID"/> <xs:element ref="MapScale"/> <xs:element name="ZoomLevel" type="ZoomLevelType"/> <xs:element name="Dimension" type="MapquestDimensionType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://weather.dto.sherlock.valhalla.starwood.com" xmlns="http://weather.dto.sherlock.valhalla.starwood.com" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <!--WEATHER ELEMENTS--> <xs:element name="ForecastedWeather" type="ForecastedWeather"/> <xs:element name="HistoricalWeather" type="HistoricalWeather"/> <xs:element name="CurrentWeather" type="CurrentWeather"/> <!--END WEATHER ELEMENTS--> <xs:complexType name="DayForecast"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>One Day Detailed Focast</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="DayOfWeek" type="DaysOfWeekEnum"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="HighTemp_F" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="LowTemp_F" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="HighTemp_C" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="LowTemp_C" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="WindDirection" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="WindSpeed" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Wind Speed in MPH</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="ProbPrecip" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Probablity of Precipitation</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="RelHumidity" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Conditions"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Weather Conditions, as an integer, to be mapped, i.e. 65=Mostly Sunny</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:minInclusive value="65"/> <xs:maxInclusive value="94"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="UVIndex"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:minInclusive value="0"/> <xs:maxInclusive value="11"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="UVDesc" type="UVDescriptionEnum"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="SunRise" type="xs:time"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="SunSet" type="xs:time"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="MoonRise" type="xs:time"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="MoonSet" type="xs:time"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="MoonPhase"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:minInclusive value="0"/> <xs:maxInclusive value="7"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="date" type="xs:dateTime" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="DaysOfWeekEnum"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Details the valid days of the week</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="Sunday"/> <xs:enumeration value="Saturday"/> <xs:enumeration value="Friday"/> <xs:enumeration value="Thursday"/> <xs:enumeration value="Wednesday"/> <xs:enumeration value="Tuesday"/> <xs:enumeration value="Monday"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UVDescriptionEnum"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Details the valid UV descriptions</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="Extreme"/> <xs:enumeration value="High"/> <xs:enumeration value="Moderate"/> <xs:enumeration value="Minimal"/> <xs:enumeration value="Low"/> <xs:enumeration value="No Report"/> <xs:enumeration value="Not Available"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="CurrentWeather"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Current weather report</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Temp_F" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>in degrees F (for both international and domestic locations)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Temp_C" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Dewpoint" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>in degrees F (for both international and domestic locations)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="RelativeHumidity" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="WindSpeed" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>in MPH</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="WindDirection" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>in degrees 0 = north</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="WindGust" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>in MPH</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="SurfacePressure" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Weather" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="SkyCover" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>cloud cover</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Ceiling" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Visibility" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Horizontal Visibility in miles</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="HeatIndex" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>the "apparent temperature" facors heat and humidity</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="SnowDepth" type="xs:decimal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>in inches (on the ground)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="station_id" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="update_time" type="xs:dateTime" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="HistoricalWeather"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Historical Weather for a given station</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="31" minOccurs="0" name="Day" type="HistoricalDataType"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="12" minOccurs="0" name="Month" type="HistoricalDataType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="station_id" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="station_name" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="HistoricalDataType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="HighTemp_F" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="HighTemp_C" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="LowTemp_F" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="LowTemp_C" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="RecHigh_F" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="RecHigh_C" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="RecHighDate" type="xs:dateTime"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="RecLow_F" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="RecLow_C" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="RecLowDate" type="xs:dateTime"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="AvgTemp_F" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="AvgTemp_C" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Precip_IN" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Precip_CM" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Snow_IN" type="xs:decimal"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Snow_CM" type="xs:decimal"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="date" type="xs:dateTime" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ForecastedWeather"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" name="DayForecast" type="DayForecast"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="update_time" type="xs:dateTime" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="location_id" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="location_name" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://poe.dto.sherlock.valhalla.starwood.com" xmlns="http://poe.dto.sherlock.valhalla.starwood.com" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <!--SHERLOCK ELEMENTS--> <xs:element name="PromoAvailability" type="PromoAvailabilityType"/> <xs:element name="Promotions" type="PromotionsType"/> <!--END type="ProductRestrictionsType"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="availablePromoCodes" nillable="true" type="PromoCodeRSType"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="unavailablePromoCodes" nillable="true" type="PromoCodeRSType"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="availableRatePlans" nillable="true" type="FullRatePlanBasedStayType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="MandatoryGuaranteeType"> <xs:attribute name="date" type="StayUniverseDateTime"/> <xs:attribute name="indicator" type="xs:boolean"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="FullRatePlanBasedStayType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This is Full Rate Plan Based Stay</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Message" type="MessageType"/> <xs:element name="RatePlanId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="RatePlanName" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="RatePlanDesc" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="RatePlanShortDesc" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="RatePlanTypeId" nillable="true" type="xs:int"/> <xs:element name="RatePlanOverrideText" nillable="true" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="ConsumerFacingRatePlanName" nillable="true" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="RateCategoryId" nillable="true" type="xs:int"/> <xs:element name="IdReqdInd" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="StartSellDate" type="StayUniverseDateTime"/> <xs:element name="EndSellDate" type="StayUniverseDateTime"/> <xs:element name="OccupancyStartDate" type="StayUniverseDateTime"/> <xs:element name="OccupancyEndDate" type="StayUniverseDateTime"/> <xs:element name="CurrencyCode" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="LengthOfStay" type="xs:int"/> <xs:element name="DailyRateIndicator" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element name="ArrivalDate" type="StayUniverseDateTime"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="RatePlanSeason" type="RatePlanSeasonType"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="SSPCode"> <xs:complexType> <xs:attribute name="Id" type="xs:int"/> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="GuaranteeOption"> <xs:complexType> <xs:attribute name="SSPCode" type="xs:int"/> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="MaxNumberOfRooms" nillable="true" type="xs:int"/> <xs:element name="SuppressRateInd" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="ProductSellSequence" type="ProductSellSequenceType"/> <xs:element name="GuaranteeRequired" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element name="GuaranteeMethod" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="CalculatedProductRate" type="CalculatedProductRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains rate data for each night and for the stay. Stay information is compiled from the sums of the nightly rates.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="Fee" type="FeeType"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="Tax" type="TaxType"/> <xs:element name="RatePlanPackageIndicator" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element name="RatePlanFrequency" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="PropertyMarketSegmentCode" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="CorpMarketSegmentCode" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="CorrelationGroup" name="ExchangeTypeCd" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="ContractedRateInd" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element name="FloatRateInd" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element name="PrntRateInd" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element name="CommissionAmt" type="xs:float"/> <xs:element name="AltDpstAddrInd" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="PackageRatePlan" type="PackageRatePlan"/> <xs:element
